NUMEROUS people have made posts requesting the ability to toggle autofill on/off.  It seems pretty simple to get the ACTUAL numbers on this, just put in that feature and bam you can clearly see in black and white how many people prioritize what.

Of course people have made requests. They don't like it when it happens. But they don't understand the consequences.

There's a lot more to just putting in the feature than you realize..... logistically speaking, there are a lot of decisions to be made:

1) Do we create an entirely separate queue, or do we allow autofill with non-autofill?
2) Do we separate MMR, since you're removing one of the systems inherent assumptions - that some of your games are with off-roles?
3) If we separate MMR, do we also create separate ranks?


Not to mention the fact that there are a lot of people who are really dumb out there(I worked tech support for 10 years, I dealt with them all the time) - people would see the feature, be like 'woohoo no autofill!', queue up, wait like 10-15 minutes, then give up and go play something else and never come back to LoL. 

I guarantee you, 100%, not a doubt in my mind, that implementing this would cost Riot - no matter how they did it - literally hundreds of thousands of customers, if not more.

Autofill should enable only after a certain amount of time has already been waited. Or give a pop up that you can get to a match but be autofilled and chose to take it or not.

Or remove the position assigning and make it MMR pick order like it used to be.

Riot has stated on numerous cases that without an auto-fill system but WITH a 'queue for role' system, the wait times would be insane due to the disparity of role preference. You can doubt them if you wish, but they have the data and I choose to trust them on this since it makes sense. As a support my queue times are insanely low, near-instant most of the time. The only way this makes sense is if there is a massive disparity in role preference.

Prior to this system being in place, EVERYONE played fill. So every game you were auto-filled. Literally every game. That's why queue times were low. Because every game your role was largely random, so of course they could make games fast. They didn't have to care what the players wanted to play, they could just throw any five players in the same rank range together and say 'have at it!'

It is perfectly reasonable to prefer that system. I don't, I like that I can queue for the role I want to play and have a relatively good chance of getting it. To each their own there.

However, claiming there was LESS toxicity in the past is rose-coloured glasses at work. You're forgetting all the negativity. Champ select was FULL of people bitching that someone else picked their role when they'd called it, and whining about who had to be support, and fighting over roles. I can't count the number of 'okay we're both jungling' or 'welp I guess we have no jungler! Have fun!' because nobody wanted to do it. Hell, the toxicity over trying to pick who had to support was a large part of why I started maining support. I figured it was easier for me to just play it and learn to love it than to have to deal with people fighting to avoid it every game. You really need to get in touch with reality if you think the old system didn't breed toxicity, man. You're LITERALLY in denial.
